column1: Newborn head molding is an abnormal head shape that results from pressure on the baby's head during childbirth.
The bones of a newborn baby's skull are soft and flexible, with gaps between the plates of bone.
The spaces between the bony plates of the skull are called cranial sutures.
When a baby is born in a head-first position, pressure on the head in the birth canal may mold the head into an oblong shape.
